organization.fullName: VA Office of Research and Development

identificationModule.briefTitle: EMG-Controlled Game to Retrain Upper Extremity Muscle Activation Patterns Following Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: EMG-Controlled Game to Retrain Upper Extremity Muscle Activation Patterns Following Stroke

leadSponsor.name: VA Office of Research and Development

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to develop and test if upper limb task practice and muscle activity training improve upper limb function in stroke survivors. Participants will be asked to come to the laboratory 3 times a week for 6 weeks to receive upper limb task practice and/or muscle activity training. Participants will also come to the laboratory for additional 3 visits for assessments of upper extremity function. The total duration of the study will be 2.5 months.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The purpose of this study is to develop and test if upper limb task practice and muscle activity training improve upper limb function in stroke survivors. Participants will be asked to come to the laboratory 3 times a week for 6 weeks to receive upper limb task practice and/or muscle activity training. Participants will also come to the laboratory for additional 3 visits for assessments of upper extremity function. The total duration of the study will be 2.5 months.

armGroups.label: EMG + task training
armGroups.description: Train with EMG-controlled games and functional task practice

armGroups.label: task training
armGroups.description: Train with functional task practice for a total of 18 sessions

interventions.name: practice muscle activation patterns
interventions.description: practice upper limb muscle activation patterns using EMG-controlled games

primaryOutcomes.description: Functional abilities scale for completing upper limb tasks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

18+ years old Stroke more than 6 months ago Moderate upper limb impairment Cognitive ability to participate in the study procedure Ability to see the full computer screen

Exclusion Criteria:

Concurrent upper limb rehabilitation Severe spasticity prohibiting voluntary muscle contraction to participate in training Change in spasticity medication or botulinum toxin injection in the upper limb within 3 months prior to or during enrollment Total sensory loss Comorbidity (e.g., orthopaedic or premorbid neurologic condition) that limit upper limb movement and/or participation in the intervention Language barrier or cognitive impairment that precludes providing consent

overallOfficials.name: Na Jin Seo, PhD MS BS
overallOfficials.affiliation: Ralph H. Johnson VA Medical Center, Charleston, SC

locations.facility: Ralph H. Johnson VA Medical Center, Charleston, SC

contacts.name: Na Jin Seo, PhD MS BS

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Only de-identified data will be shared in publications, in conference presentations, and upon data sharing request.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: After the primary data are published for up to 5 years from the study completion.
